ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This protocol assumes the client has previously logged on to the messaging server as described in [MS-OXCROPS] and has acquired a handle to the folder it needs to set the rules (2) to and retrieve the rules (2) from, as described in [MS-OXCFOLD].
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This protocol also relies on the use of the underlying ROP transport protocol described in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In Vendor-Extensible Fields] A third party application can create its own set of rules (2) by using its custom string as the value of the PidTagRuleProvider property as specified in section 2.2.1.3.1.5.
[In Vendor-Extensible Fields] There is no centralized authority that ensures uniqueness of rule provider strings across different client applications.
[In Transport] The standard rules, as specified in sections 2.2.1, 2.2.2, and 2.2.3, are built by using the ROP List and Encoding Protocol specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In Transport] The extended rules portion of the protocol, as specified in section 2.2.4, is built by using the Message and Attachment Protocol specified in [MS-OXCMSG].
[In Transport] The ROP request buffer and ROP response buffer specified by this protocol are sent to and received from the server respectively using the underlying protocol specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In Message Syntax] Standard rules are the most common and typical way of specifying rules (2) for a folder.
[In Message Syntax] Sections 2.2.1, 2.2.2, and 2.2.3 specify the ROP request buffers and ROP response buffers specific to this protocol.
[In Message Syntax] The syntax of these requests and responses is documented in [MS-OXCROPS], as specified in each section below.
[In Message Syntax] Unless otherwise noted, sizes in this section are expressed in bytes.
[In Message Syntax] Unless otherwise noted, the fields specified in this section are packed in buffers in the order they appear in this document, without any padding in little-endian format.
[In RopModifyRules ROP] The RopModifyRules ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.1) creates, modifies, or deletes rules (2) in a folder.
[In RopModifyRules ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopModifyRules ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields [InputHandleIndex, ModifyRulesFlag, R, X, RulesCount, and RulesData] for the RopModifyRules ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.1.1).

[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The index to the input handle for this operation, which is a Folder object handle representing the folder for which rules (2) are to be modified.
[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] ModifyRulesFlags (1 byte): A bitmask that specifies how the rules (2) included in this structure are created on the server.
[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] ModifyRulesFlag (8 bits): Its structure [binary of ModifyRulesFlag] is as follows: XXXXXXXR.
[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] [ModifyRulesFlag] R (Bitmask 0x01): If this bit is set, the rules (2) in this request are to replace the existing set of rules (2) in the folder.

[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] [ModifyRulesFlag] R (Bitmask 0x01): [If this bit is set, the rules (2) in this request are to replace the existing set of rules (2) in the folder;] in this case, all subsequent RuleData structures, as specified in section 2.2.1.3, MUST have the ROW_ADD flag as the value of their RuleDataFlags field, as specified in section 2.2.1.3.1.

[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] [ModifyRulesFlag] R (Bitmask 0x01): If this bit is not set, the rules (2) specified in this request represent changes (delete, modify, and add) to the set of rules (2) already existing in this folder.
[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] [ModifyRulesFlag] x: Unused. This bit MUST be set to zero (0) when sent.
[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] RulesCount (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of RuleData structures present in the RulesData field.
[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] RulesData (variable): An array of RuleData structures, each of which specifies details about a standard rule.
[In RopModifyRules ROP Request Buffer] [RulesData] The format of the RuleData structure is specified in section 2.2.1.3.
[In RopModifyRules ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions [InputHandleIndex and RetrunValue] define valid fields for the RopModifyRules ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.1.2).

[In RopModifyRules ROP Response Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The input handle in the response buffer MUST be the same as the index to the input handle in the request buffer for this operation [Processing RopModifyRules ROP Response].
[In RopModifyRules ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): A value that indicates the result of the operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R680.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopModifyRules ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue: To indicate success, the server returns 0x00000000.
[In RopModifyRules ROP Response Buffer] For a list of common error return values, see [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.4.
[In RuleData Structure] The RuleData structure contains properties and flags that provide details about a standard rule.
[In RuleData Structure] The format of the RuleData structure is as follows [RuleDataFlags, PropertyValueCount, and PropertyValues].
[In RuleData Structure] RuleDataFlags (1 byte): A value that contains flags specifying whether the rule (2) is to be added, modified, or deleted.
[In RuleData Structure] [RuleDataFlags (1 byte)] The valid values [ROW_ADD, ROW_MODIFY, and ROW_REMOVE] are specified in the following table.
[In RuleData Structure] [RuleDataFlags (1 byte)] The value of the flag ROW_ADD: 0x01.
[In RuleData Structure] [RuleDataFlags (1 byte)] The description of the flag ROW_ADD: Adds the data in the rule buffer to the rule set as a new rule (2).
[In RuleData Structure] [RuleDataFlags (1 byte)] The value of the flag ROW_MODIFY: 0x02.
[In RuleData Structure] [RuleDataFlags (1 byte)] The description of the flag ROW_MODIFY: Modifies the existing rule (2) identified by the value of the PidTagRuleId property (section 2.2.1.3.1.1).
[In RuleData Structure] [RuleDataFlags (1 byte)] The value of the flag ROW_REMOVE: 0x04.
[In RuleData Structure] [RuleDataFlags (1 byte)] The description of the flag ROW_REMOVE: Removes from the rule set the rule (2) that has the same value of the PidTagRuleId property.
[In RuleData Structure] PropertyValueCount (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of properties that are specified in the PropertyValues field.
[In RuleData Structure] PropertyValueCount (2 bytes): This field MUST be greater than zero.
[In RuleData Structure] PropertyValues (variable): An array of TaggedPropertyValue structures, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.4, each of which contains one property of a standard rule.
[In RuleData Structure] This field [PropertyValues] MUST contain only properties that are valid for a standard rule, as specified in section 2.2.1.3.1.
[In RuleData Structure] The number of TaggedPropertyValue structures contained in this field [PropertyValues] is specified in the PropertyValueCount field.
[In Properties of a Standard Rule] The properties for a standard rule are specified in sections 2.2.1.3.1.1 through 2.2.1.3.1.10.

[In Properties of a Standard Rule] These properties [PidTagRuleId, PidTagRuleSequence, PidTagRuleState, PidTagRuleName, PidTagRuleProvider, PidTagRuleLevel, PidTagRuleUserFlags, PidTagRuleProviderData, PidTagRuleCondition, PidTagRuleActions] are set by using the RopModifyRules ROP (section 2.2.1).
[In Properties of a Standard Rule] The RuleData structure, which is specified in section 2.2.1.3, contains the property settings for each standard rule.
[In PidTagRuleId Property] Type: PtypInteger64 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleId Property] The PidTagRuleId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.940) specifies a unique identifier the messaging server generates for each rule (2) when the rule (2) is first created.
[In PidTagRuleId Property] The PidTagRuleId property MUST NOT be used when requesting that a new rule (2) be created.
[In PidTagRuleId Property] The PidTagRuleId property MUST be used when requesting that a rule (2) be modified or deleted.
[In PidTagRuleSequence Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleSequence Property] The PidTagRuleSequence property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.953) contains a value used to determine the order in which rules (2) are evaluated and executed.
[In PidTagRuleSequence Property] rules (2) are evaluated in sequence according to the increasing order of this value [is contained in PidTagRuleSequence Property].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R514.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleSequence Property] The evaluation order for rules (2) that have the same value in the PidTagRuleSequence property is undefined: the server can choose an arbitrary order for rules (2) with the same value, but that does not affect the sequence of other rules (2).
[In PidTagRuleState Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleState Property] The PidTagRuleState property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.954) contains a value interpreted as a Bitmask combination of flags that specify the state of the rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleState Property] The binary value of the PidTagRuleState property is defined as follows: X (PE) (SCL) (EL) (HI) (OF) (ER) (EN) XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] EN (ST_ENABLED, Bitmask 0x00000001): The rule (2) is enabled for execution.
[In PidTagRuleState] EN (ST_ENABLED, Bitmask 0x00000001): If neither this flag nor the ST_ONLY_WHEN_OOF flag are set, the server skips this rule (2) when evaluating rules (2).
[In PidTagRuleState Property] ER (ST_ERROR, Bitmask 0x00000002): The server has encountered any no parsing error processing the rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleState] ER (ST_ERROR, Bitmask 0x00000002): This flag is not to be set by the client.
[In PidTagRuleState]ER (ST_ERROR, Bitmask 0x00000002): This flag is to be ignored by the server if it is [set by the client].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R844.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleState Property] The RopModifyRules ROP replies the same response whether this Bitmask ER is set to 0 or 1.

[In PidTagRuleState] OF (ST_ONLY_WHEN_OOF, Bitmask 0x00000004): The rule (2) is executed only when a user sets the Out of Office (OOF) state on the mailbox, as specified in [MS-OXWOOF] section 2.2.5.2.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] OF (ST_ONLY_WHEN_OOF, Bitmask 0x00000004): This flag MUST NOT be set in a public folder rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleState Property] OF (ST_ONLY_WHEN_OOF, Bitmask 0x00000004): For details on this flag, see section 3.2.5.1.1.1.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] HI (ST_KEEP_OOF_HIST, Bitmask 0x00000008): For details, see section 3.2.5.1.1.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] HI (ST_KEEP_OOF_HIST, Bitmask 0x00000008): This flag MUST NOT be set in a public folder rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleState Property] EL (ST_EXIT_LEVEL, Bitmask 0x00000010): rule (2) evaluation will terminate after executing this rule (2) except for evaluation of Out of Office rules.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] EL (ST_EXIT_LEVEL, Bitmask 0x00000010): rule (2) evaluation will not terminate after executing this rule (2) if for evaluation of Out of Office rules.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] EL (ST_EXIT_LEVEL, Bitmask 0x00000010): For details, see section 3.2.5.1.1.1.

[In PidTagRuleState Property] SCL (ST_SKIP_IF_SCL_IS_SAFE, Bitmask 0x00000020): Evaluation of this rule (2) MAY be skipped if the delivered message's PidTagContentFilterSpamConfidenceLevel property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.638) has a value of 0xFFFFFFFF.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R7411.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleState Property] PE (ST_RULE_PARSE_ERROR, Bitmask 0x00000040): The server has encountered rule (2) data from the client that is in an incorrect format, which caused an error parsing the rule (2) data.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] PE (ST_RULE_PARSE_ERROR, Bitmask 0x00000040): This flag is not to be set by the client.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] PE (ST_RULE_PARSE_ERROR, Bitmask 0x00000040): This flag is to be ignored by the server if it is [set by the client].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R846.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleState Property] PE (ST_RULE_PARSE_ERROR, Bitmask 0x00000040): The RopModifyRules ROP replies the same response whether this flag is set or not.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] x: Unused by this protocol.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] x: Bit locations marked with x are to be set to 0.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] x: Bit locations marked with x SHOULD NOT be modified by the client.
[In PidTagRuleState Property] x: Bit locations marked with x are ignored by the server.<1>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXORULE_R621, MS-OXORULE_R624, MS-OXORULE_R625.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleName Property] The PidTagRuleName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.950) specifies the name of the rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleProvider Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleProvider Property] The PidTagRuleProvider property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.951) identifies the client application that owns the rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleProvider Property] The client specifies this property when adding or modifying a rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleProvider Property] Rules that are stored on folders are associated with the application that owns the rules (2) by using a rule provider string.
[In PidTagRuleProvider Property] Each client application is to only add, modify or delete rules (2) that it is responsible for.
[In PidTagRuleProvider Property] A client can define its own rule provider string.
[In PidTagRuleProvider Property] The value of the string MUST NOT be the same as a rule provider string being used by another client that could be setting rules (2) on the same folder.<2>
[In PidTagRuleLevel Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleLevel Property] The PidTagRuleLevel property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.942) is not used.
[In PidTagRuleLevel Property] If a client requests that this property be set, the requested value MUST be 0x00000000.
[In PidTagRuleUserFlags Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleUserFlags Property] The PidTagRuleUserFlags property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.955) is an opaque property that the client sets for the exclusive use of the client.
[In PidTagRuleUserFlags Property] The server is to preserve this value [is contained by PidTagRuleUserFlags Property] if set by the client.
[In PidTagRuleUserFlags Property] The server ignores its contents [value of PidTagRuleUserFlags] during rule (2) evaluation and processing.
[In PidTagRuleProviderData Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleProviderData Property] The PidTagRuleProviderData property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.952) is an opaque property that the client sets for the exclusive use of the client.
[In PidTagRuleProviderData Property] The server is to preserve this value [is contained by PidTagRuleUserFlags Property] if set by the client.
[In PidTagRuleProviderData Property] The server ignores its contents [value of PidTagRuleProviderData] during rule (2) evaluation and processing.
[In PidTagRuleCondition Property] Type: PtypRestriction ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleCondition Property] The PidTagRuleCondition property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.937) sets the condition used when evaluating the rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleCondition Property] The condition is expressed as a restriction (2), as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.
[In PidTagRuleActions Property] Type: PtypRuleAction ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleActions Property] The PidTagRuleActions property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.935) contains the set of actions (2) associated with the rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleActions Property] Its structure [PidTagRuleActions] is specified in section 2.2.5.

[In RopGetRulesTable ROP] The RopGetRulesTable ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.2) creates a Table object through which the client can access the standard rules in a folder using table operations as specified in [MS-OXCTABL].
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP] The table returned by the server is required to contain all standard rules associated with a given folder.
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP] Each row in the table MUST represent one rule (2).
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopGetRulesTable ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields [InputHandleIndex (1 byte) and TableFlags (1 byte)] for the RopGetRulesTable ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.2.1).

[In RopGetRulesTable ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The index to the input handle for this operation, which is a Folder object handle representing the folder for which rules (2) are to be retrieved.
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP Request Buffer] TableFlags (1 byte): The possible values for these bits [binary of TableFlags] are as follows: XXXXXXXU.
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP Request Buffer] [TableFlags] U: (Bitmask 0x40): This bit is set if the client is requesting that string values in the table be returned as Unicode strings.
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP Request Buffer] [TableFlags] x: These unused bits MUST be set to zero (0) by the client.
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP Request Buffer] [TableFlags] x: The server SHOULD<3> return an error if these bits are nonzero but can ignore them.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXORULE_R800, MS-OXORULE_R889.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetRulesTable ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields [OutputHandleIndex (8 bits) and RetureValue (4 bytes)] for the RopGetRulesTable ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.2.2).
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP Response Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): The index to the output handle for this operation [Processing RopGetRulesTable ROP Response].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R690.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetRulesTable ROP Response Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): MUST be set to the value of the OutputHandleIndex field specified in the request.
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An integer indicating the result of the operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R133.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetRulesTable ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): To indicate success, the server returns 0x00000000.
[In RopGetRulesTable ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For a list of common error return values, see [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.4.
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP] The complete syntax of the RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP request and response buffers is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP] The RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP instructs the server to update the PidTagDamOriginalEntryId property (section 2.2.6.3) on one or more DAMs.
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields [InputHandleIndex (1 byte), ServerEntryIdSize (2 bytes), ServerEntryId (variable), ClientEntryIdSize (2 bytes), and ClientEntryId (variable)] for the RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.3.1).
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The index to the input handle for this operation, which is a Logon object handle.
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Request Buffer] ServerEntryIdSize (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the length, in bytes, of the ServerEntryId field specified.
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Request Buffer] ServerEntryId (variable): A byte array representing the EntryID of the DAM on the server.
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Request Buffer] ServerEntryId (variable): The length of this byte array is specified by the ServerEntryIdSize field.
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Request Buffer] ClientEntryIdSize (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the length, in bytes, of the ClientEntryId field.
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Request Buffer] ClientEntryId (variable): A byte array representing the EntryID of the message downloaded by the client to which the DAM will now apply.
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Request Buffer] ClientEntryId (variable): The length of this byte array is specified by the ClientEntryIdSize field.

[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields [InputHandleIndex (1 byte) and ReturnValue (4 bytes)] for the RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.3.2).
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Response Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The index to the input handle for this operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R145.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Response Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): This value MUST be the same as the index to the input handle in the request buffer for this operation [Processing RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Response].
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): The result of the operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R147.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue: To indicate success, the server returns 0x00000000.
[In RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For a list of common error return values, see [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.4.

[In Extended Rules Message Syntax] Using standard rules for message processing, as specified in section 2.2.1, section 2.2.2, and section 2.2.3, has one major limitation as a consequence of using the ROP layer as the underlying transport: there is an inherent size limitation of 32 kilobytes per ROP package.
[In Extended Rules Message Syntax] To work around this limitation, extended rules were created.

[In Extended Rules Message Syntax] Extended rules are built using the Message and Attachment Protocol, as specified in [MS-OXCMSG], so that messages can be spread over multiple ROPs to avoid the size limitation.

[In Extended Rules Message Syntax] An extended rule is defined as an FAI message in a folder that has the value of the PidTagMessageClass property ([MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.1.3) set to "IPM.ExtendedRule.Message".
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R167.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Extended Rules Message Syntax] This FAI message also has a set of rule-related properties set on it, as specified in the following subsections.
[In Extended Rules Message Syntax] To create, modify, or delete an extended rule, the application is required to create, modify, or delete the underlying FAI message.
[In Extended Rules Message Syntax] Extended rules use a different set of properties than the RopModifyRules ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.1).

[In Extended Rules Message Syntax] However, these properties [a different set of properties than the RopModifyRules ROP] map to properties for RopModifyRules; and except where noted, their formats are identical and the same syntactic restrictions and semantic meanings of values apply as the respective property defined in section 2.2.1.3.1.

[In Properties of an Extended Rule] The following properties [PidTagRuleMessageName, PidTagMessageClass, PidTagRuleMessageSequence, PidTagRuleMessageState, PidTagRuleMessageUserFlags, PidTagRuleMessageLevel, PidTagRuleMessageProvider, PidTagRuleMessageProviderData, PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions, and PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition] have a particular meaning when set on FAI messages representing an extended rule.
[In Properties of an Extended Rule] The application can store additional meta-data in any other property on the FAI message.
[In Properties of an Extended Rule] The server is to ignore any properties not explicitly listed here when evaluating an extended rule.
[In PidTagRuleMessageName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleMessageName Property] The PidTagRuleMessageName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.944) SHOULD be set on the FAI message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R894.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageName Property] This property has the same semantics as the PidTagRuleName property (section 2.2.1.3.1.4). [The PidTagRuleMessageName property specifies the name of the rule (2).]
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] The PidTagMessageClass property ([MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.1.3) MUST be set on the FAI message.
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] The PidTagMessageClass property ([MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.1.3) MUST have a value of "IPM.ExtendedRule.Message".
[In PidTagRuleMessageSequence Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleMessageSequence Property] The PidTagRuleMessageSequence property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.947) MUST be set on the FAI message.

[In PidTagRuleMessageSequence Property] This property has the same semantics as the PidTagRuleSequence property (section 2.2.1.3.1.2). [The PidTagRuleMessageSequence property contains a value used to determine the order in which rules (2) are evaluated and executed.]
[In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] The PidTagRuleMessageState property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.948) MUST be set on the FAI message.

[In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] This property has the same semantics and flag meanings as the PidTagRuleState property (section 2.2.1.3.1.3). [EN (ST_ENABLED, Bitmask 0x00000001): The rule (2) is enabled for execution.]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R516.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] This property has the same semantics and flag meanings as the PidTagRuleState property (section 2.2.1.3.1.3). [ER (ST_ERROR, Bitmask 0x00000002): The server has encountered any nonparsing error processing the rule (2).]

[In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] This property has the same semantics and flag meanings as the PidTagRuleState property (section 2.2.1.3.1.3). [OF (ST_ONLY_WHEN_OOF, Bitmask 0x00000004): The rule (2) is executed only when a user sets the Out of Office (OOF) state on the mailbox.]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R517, MS-OXORULE_R582.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] This property has the same semantics and flag meanings as the PidTagRuleState property (section 2.2.1.3.1.3). [The PidTagRuleMessageState property contains a value interpreted as a Bitmask combination of flags that specify the state of the rule (2).]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R516, MS-OXORULE_R517, MS-OXORULE_R560, MS-OXORULE_R583.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] This property has the same semantics and flag meanings as the PidTagRuleState property (section 2.2.1.3.1.3). [EL (ST_EXIT_LEVEL, Bitmask 0x00000010): rule (2) evaluation will terminate after executing this rule (2), if not for evaluation of Out of Office rules.]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R560.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] This property has the same semantics and flag meanings as the PidTagRuleState property (section 2.2.1.3.1.3). [SCL (ST_SKIP_IF_SCL_IS_SAFE, Bitmask 0x00000020): Evaluation of this rule (2) will be skipped if the delivered message's PidTagContentFilterSpamConfidenceLevel property has a value of 0xFFFFFFFF.]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R74.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] This property has the same semantics and flag meanings as the PidTagRuleState property (section 2.2.1.3.1.3). [PE (ST_RULE_PARSE_ERROR, Bitmask 0x00000040): The server has encountered rule (2) data from the client that is in an incorrect format, which caused an error parsing the rule (2) data.]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R913.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] This property has the same semantics and flag meanings as the PidTagRuleState property (section 2.2.1.3.1.3). [x: Unused by this protocol.]

[In PidTagRuleMessageState Property] This property has the same semantics and flag meanings as the PidTagRuleState property (section 2.2.1.3.1.3). [EL (ST_EXIT_LEVEL, Bitmask 0x00000010): rule (2) evaluation will not terminate after executing this rule (2), if for evaluation of Out of Office rules.]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R807.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageUserFlags Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleMessageUserFlags Property] This PidTagRuleMessageUserFlags property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.949) MAY be set on the FAI message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R891.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageUserFlags Property] This property has the same semantics as the PidTagRuleUserFlags property (section 2.2.1.3.1.7). [The PidTagRuleMessageUserFlags property is an opaque property that the client sets for the exclusive use of the client.]
[In PidTagRuleMessageLevel Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleMessageLevel Property] The PidTagRuleMessageLevel property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.943) SHOULD be set on the FAI message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R892.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageLevel Property] This property has the same semantics as the PidTagRuleLevel property (section 2.2.1.3.1.6). [The PidTagRuleMessageLevel property is not used.]
[In PidTagRuleMessageProvider Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleMessageProvider Property] The PidTagRuleMessageProvider property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.945) MUST be set on the FAI message.

[In PidTagRuleMessageProvider Property] This property has the same semantics as the PidTagRuleProvider property (section 2.2.1.3.1.5). [The PidTagRuleMessageProvider property identifies the client application that owns the rule (2).]
[In PidTagRuleMessageProviderData Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleMessageProviderData Property] The PidTagRuleMessageProviderData property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.946) MAY be set on the FAI message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R893.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleMessageProviderData Property] This property has the same syntax and semantics as the PidTagRuleProviderData property) section 2.2.1.3.1.8). [The PidTagRuleMessageProviderData property is an opaque property that the client sets for the exclusive use of the client.]
[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] The PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.683) MUST be set on the FAI message.

[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] This property [PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] serves the same purpose for extended rules as the PidTagRuleActions property (section 2.2.1.3.1.10) serves for standard rules. [The PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions property contains the set of actions (2) associated with the rule (2).]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R231, MS-OXORULE_R232, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] [This property serves the same purpose for extended rules as the PidTagRuleActions property (section 2.2.1.3.1.10) serves for standard rules;] however, it contains additional information about the named properties used.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R206, MS-OXORULE_R208.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] The format of the PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions property is as follows: NamedPropertyInformation, RuleVersion, RuleActionsBuffer.

[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] NamedPropertyInformation (variable): A structure that specifies information about named properties used in this action (2) as specified in section 2.2.4.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R217, MS-OXORULE_R218, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.4.2.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] RuleVersion (4 bytes): Specifies the extended rules version format.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R208.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] RuleVersion (4 bytes): This document defines version 1, and thus this value MUST be set to 0x00000001.

[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] RuleActionsBuffer (variable): A RuleAction structure, as specified in section 2.2.5, containing the actions (2) to be executed when the condition for the rule (2) to which these actions (2) apply evaluates to "TRUE".
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R231, MS-OXORULE_R232, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageActions Property] All string values contained in any part of the RuleAction structure MUST be in Unicode format.
[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] The PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.684) MUST be set on the FAI message.

[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] This property serves the same purpose for extended rules as the PidTagRuleCondition property (section 2.2.1.3.1.9) serves for standard rules. [The PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition property sets the condition used when evaluating the rule (2).]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R214, MS-OXORULE_R215.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] [This property serves the same purpose for extended rules as the PidTagRuleCondition property (section 2.2.1.3.1.9) serves for standard rules;] However, it contains additional information about the named properties used.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R213.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] All string values contained in any part of this condition property value MUST be in Unicode format.

[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] If the PidTagExtendedRuleSizeLimit property ([MS-OXCSTOR] section 2.2.2.1.1.1) is set on the Logon object, the client is required to keep the size of the PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition property under the value specified by the PidTagExtendedRuleSizeLimit property.
[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] The format of the PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition property is as follows: NamedPropertyInformation, RuleRestriction.

[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] NamedPropertyInformation (variable): A structure that specifies information about named properties used in this condition, as specified in section 2.2.4.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R217, MS-OXORULE_R218, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.4.2.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] RuleRestriction (variable): A structure containing the condition to be evaluated.
[In PidTagExtendedRuleMessageCondition Property] RuleRestriction (variable): The condition is expressed as a restriction, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] The NamedPropertyInformation structure provides context to any named properties that are present in the structure it precedes.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R217, MS-OXORULE_R218, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.4.2.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] For every distinct (unique) named property used in the structure it precedes, the NamedPropertyInformation structure contains one property ID - named property pair.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] The format of the NamedPropertyInformation structure is as follows: NoOfNamedProps, PropIds, NamedPropertiesSize and NamedProperties.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] Note that if there are no named properties to be listed, the NamedPropertyInformation structure reduces to a 2-byte value of 0x0000.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] NoOfNamedProps (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of named property mappings that are packed in this structure [NamedPropertyInformation].

[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] NoOfNamedProps (2 bytes): If no named properties are used in the structure that follows the NamedPropertyInformation structure, the value of this field MUST be 0x0000.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] [If no named properties are used in the structure that follows the NamedPropertyInformation structure] no other fields [except NoOfNamedProps] are present.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] PropIds (variable): An array of property IDs, each of which is a value of 0x8000 or greater.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] PropIds (variable): [An array of property IDs, each of which] uniquely identifies the named property within an extended rule.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] There MUST be one property ID in this array [PropIds] for each PropertyName structure in the NamedProperties field.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] NamedPropertiesSize (4 bytes): The total size, in bytes, of the following fields [NamedProperties].
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] NamedPropertiesSize (4 bytes): Only present if NoOfNamedProps is greater than zero.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] NamedProperties (variable): An array of PropertyName structures.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] NamedProperties (variable): [An array of PropertyName structures] Each of which contains details about a named property.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] The format of the PropertyName structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.6.1.
[In NamedPropertyInformation Structure] The PropertyName structures in this field [NamedProperties] MUST coincide with the property IDs in the PropIds field.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R938.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RuleAction Structure] The RuleAction structure MUST have one or more blocks of a binary data [NoOfActions, ActionBloks] to specify various actions (2) of the rule (2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R231, MS-OXORULE_R232, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.1.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RuleAction Structure] The RuleAction structure has the following format for standard rules: NoOfActions, ActionBloks.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R231, MS-OXORULE_R232, and MS-OXORULE_R947.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RuleAction Structure] The format for extended rules is the same except that the size of the NoOfActions field is 4 bytes instead of 2 bytes.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R231, MS-OXORULE_R232, MS-OXORULE_R945, and MS-OXORULE_R947.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RuleAction Structure] NoOfActions (2 bytes): Specifies the number of structures that are contained in the ActionBlocks field.
[In RuleAction Structure] NoOfActions (2 bytes): This number MUST be greater than zero.
[In RuleAction Structure] For extended rules, the size of the NoOfActions field is 4 bytes instead of 2 bytes.
[In RuleAction Structure] ActionBlocks (variable): An array of ActionBlock structures, each of which specifies an action (2) of the rule (2), as specified in section 2.2.5.1.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The ActionBlock structure has the following format for standard rules: ActionLength, ActionType, ActionFlavor, ActionFlags, and ActionData.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R236, MS-OXORULE_R949, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.1.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ActionBlock Structure] The format for extended rules is the same except that the size of the ActionLength field is 4 bytes instead of 2 bytes.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R236, MS-OXORULE_R245, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.1.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ActionBlock Structure] ActionLength (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the cumulative length, in bytes, of the subsequent fields in this ActionBlock structure.
[In ActionBlock Structure] ActionLength (2 bytes): For extended rules, the size of the ActionLength field is 4 bytes instead of 2 bytes.
[In ActionBlock Structure] ActionType (1 byte): An integer that specifies the type of action (2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R245, MS-OXORULE_R246, and other specific requirements about action in section 2.2.5.1.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ActionBlock Structure] The valid actions (2) [of ActionType] are listed in the following table: OP_MOVE, OP_COPY, OP_REPLY, OP_OOF_REPLY, OP_DEFER_ACTION, OP_BOUNCE, OP_FORWARD, OP_DELEGATE, OP_TAG, OP_DELETE, OP_MARK_AS_READ.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_MOVE: 0x01.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_MOVE: Moves the message to a folder.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_MOVE: MUST NOT be used in a public folder rule (2).
[In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_COPY: 0x02.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_COPY: Copies the message to a folder.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_COPY: MUST NOT be used in a public folder rule (2).
[In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_REPLY: 0x03.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_REPLY: Replies to the message.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_OOF_REPLY: 0x04.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_OOF_REPLY: Sends an OOF reply to the message.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_DEFER_ACTION: 0x05.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_DEFER_ACTION: Used for actions (2) that cannot be executed by the server (like playing a sound).
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_DEFER_ACTION: MUST NOT be used in a public folder rule (2).
[In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_BOUNCE: 0x06.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_BOUNCE: Rejects the message back to the sender.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_FORWARD: 0x07.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_FORWARD: Forwards the message to a recipient (2) address.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R537.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_DELEGATE: 0x08.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_DELEGATE: Resends the message to another recipient (2), who acts as a delegate.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R539.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_TAG: 0x09.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_TAG: Adds or changes a property on the message.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_DELETE: 0x0A.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_DELETE: Deletes the message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R549.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ActionBlock Structure] The value of action type OP_MARK_AS_READ: 0x0B.
[In ActionBlock Structure] The meaning of action type OP_MARK_AS_READ: Sets the MSGFLAG_READ flag in the PidTagMessageFlags property ([MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.1.6) on the message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R551.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ActionBlock Structure] ActionFlavor (4 bytes): The flags that are associated with a particular type of action (2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R272, MS-OXORULE_R273, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.1.1.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ActionBlock Structure] ActionFlavor (4 bytes): The flags MUST be used in conjunction with the type of action (2) that supports them and MUST be zero otherwise.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R272, MS-OXORULE_R273, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.1.1.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ActionBlock Structure] For more details see section 2.2.5.1.1.
[In ActionBlock Structure] ActionFlags (4 bytes): Client-defined flags.
[In ActionBlock Structure] ActionFlags (4 bytes): The ActionFlags field is used solely by the client.<4>
[In ActionBlock Structure] ActionFlags (4 bytes): It is not used by the server but stored only.
[In ActionBlock Structure] ActionData (variable): An ActionData structure, as specified in section 2.2.5.1.2, that specifies data related to the particular action (2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R294, MS-OXORULE_R880, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.1.2.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Action Flavors] The ActionFlavor field contains flags used in conjunction with the ActionType field and specifies additional information associated with the action (2) to be taken.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R272, MS-OXORULE_R273, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.1.1.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Action Flavors] The only ActionType field values that currently support an Action Flavor are "OP_REPLY", "OP_OOF_REPLY" and "OP_FORWARD".
[In Action Flavors] The value of the ActionFlavor field MUST be 0x00000000 if the value of the ActionType field is not one of these values [OP_REPLY, OP_OOF_REPLY, and OP_FORWARD].

[In Action Flavors] If the value of the ActionType field is "OP_FORWARD", the ActionFlavor field contains a combination of the bitwise flags [XXXX (TM) (AT) (NC) (PR) XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX] specified as follows.
[In Action Flavors] PR (Bitmask 0x00000001): Preserves the sender information and indicates that the message was auto forwarded.
[In Action Flavors] PR (Bitmask 0x00000001): Can be combined with the NC ActionFlavor flag.
[In Action Flavors] NC (Bitmask 0x00000002): Forwards the message without making any changes to the message.
[In Action Flavors] NC (Bitmask 0x00000002): Can be combined with the PR ActionFlavor flag.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R276.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Action Flavors] AT (Bitmask 0x00000004): Forwards the message as an attachment.
[In Action Flavors] AT (Bitmask 0x00000004): This value MUST NOT be combined with other ActionFlavor flags.
[In Action Flavors] TM (Bitmask 0x00000008): Indicates that the message SHOULD<5> be forwarded as a Short Message Service (SMS) text message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXORULE_R897, MS-OXORULE_R802.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Action Flavors] TM (Bitmask 0x00000008): This value MUST NOT be combined with other ActionFlavor flags.
[In Action Flavors] x: Unused.
[In Action Flavors] x: This bit MUST be set to 0 by the client.
[In Action Flavors] x: This bit MUST be ignored by the server.

[In Action Flavors] If the ActionType field value is "OP_REPLY", the ActionFlavor field MUST have one of the values specified in the following table [XXXXXX (ST) (NS) XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX] or zero (0x00000000).

[In Action Flavors] [If the ActionType field value is "OP_REPLY", the ActionFlavor field MUST have one of the values specified in the following table [XXXXXX (ST) (NS) XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX] or zero (0x00000000)] A value of zero (0x00000000) indicates standard reply behavior, as specified in section 3.1.4.2.5).

[In Action Flavors] If the ActionType field value is "OP_OOF_REPLY", the ActionFlavor field MUST have one of the values specified in the following table [XXXXXX (ST) (NS) XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX] or zero (0x00000000).

[In Action Flavors] [If the ActionType field value is "OP_OOF_REPLY", the ActionFlavor field MUST have one of the values specified in the following table [XXXXXX (ST) (NS) XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX] or zero (0x00000000)] A value of zero (0x00000000) indicates standard reply behavior, as specified in section 3.1.4.2.5.
[In Action Flavors] NS (Bitmask 0x00000001): [OP_OOF_REPLY ActionType] The server SHOULD <6> not send the message to the message sender.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R10192.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Action Flavors] NS (Bitmask 0x00000001): [OP_REPLY ActionType] Do not send the message to the message sender.

[In Action Flavors] NS (Bitmask 0x00000001): [OP_OOF_REPLY ActionType] [The server SHOULD<6> not send the message to the message sender]The reply template MUST contain recipients (2) in this case [if the NS flag is set].
[In Action Flavors] NS (Bitmask 0x00000001): [OP_REPLY ActionType] The reply template MUST contain recipients (2) in this case [if the NS flag is set].
[In Action Flavors] ST (Bitmask 0x00000002): Server will use fixed, server-defined text in the reply message and ignore the text in the reply template.
[In Action Flavors] ST (Bitmask 0x00000002): This text [Fixed and server-defined text in the reply message] is an implementation detail.
[In Action Flavors] x: Unused.
[In Action Flavors] x: This bit MUST be set to 0 by the client
[In Action Flavors] x: This bit MUST be ignored by the server.
[In ActionData Structure] The ActionData structure is different for each type of action (2).
[In ActionData Structure] The various ActionData structures are specified in section 2.2.5.1.2.1 through section 2.2.5.1.2.7.
[In ActionData Structure] The appropriate structure MUST be used for the action (2) that is specified in the ActionType field of the ActionBlock structure.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R294, MS-OXORULE_R880, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.1.2.1 to section 2.2.5.2.2.7.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] A Move/Copy action (2) is used to move or copy an incoming message to a specified folder in the destination message store.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R247, MS-OXORULE_R250.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] The ActionData structure used in an action (2) of type "OP_MOVE" or "OP_COPY" is one of two formats, depending on whether the rule is a standard rule or an extended rule.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R294, MS-OXORULE_R880, MS-OXORULE_R966, MS-OXORULE_R967.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The OP_MOVE ActionData structure MUST be in the following format for a standard rule. [FolderInThisStore, StoreEIDSize, StoreEID, FolderEIDSize, and FolderEID].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The OP_COPY ActionData structure MUST be in the following format for a standard rule. [FolderInThisStore, StoreEIDSize, StoreEID, FolderEIDSize, and FolderEID].
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The destination folder for a Move action in a standard rule can be in the user's mailbox.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The destination folder for a Copy action in a standard rule can be in the user's mailbox.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The destination folder for a Move action in a standard rule can be in a different mailbox.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The destination folder for a Copy action in a standard rule can be in a different mailbox.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] FolderInThisStore (1 byte): A Boolean value that indicates whether the folder is in the user's mailbox or a different mailbox.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R703.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] FolderInThisStore (1 byte): This field SHOULD<7> be set to 0x01, if the destination folder is in the user's mailbox,
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R7032.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] FolderInThisStore (1 byte): This field MUST be set to 0x00, if the destination folder is outside the user's mailbox (for example, a local message store that the server cannot access).
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] StoreEIDSize (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the StoreEID field.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] StoreEID (variable): A Store Object EntryID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.4.3, [In OP_COPY action data] Identifies the message store.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] StoreEID (variable): A Store Object EntryID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.4.3, [In OP_MOVE action data] Identifies the message store.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] This field [StoreEID] is relevant only if the FolderInThisStore field is set to 0x00.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] If the FolderInThisStore field is set to 0x01, the following applies to the StoreEID field for the client: The StoreEID field can be set to any non-null value.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] If the FolderInThisStore field is set to 0x01, the following applies to the StoreEID field for the server: The StoreEID field can be set to any non-null value.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] If the FolderInThisStore field is set to 0x01, the following applies to the StoreEID field for the client: The contents of the StoreEID field MUST be ignored when received.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] If the FolderInThisStore field is set to 0x01, the following applies to the StoreEID field for the server: The contents of the StoreEID field MUST be ignored when received.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] FolderEIDSize (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the FolderEID field.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] FolderEID (variable): A structure that identifies the destination folder.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] If the value of the FolderInThisStore field is 0x01, this field [FolderEID] contains a ServerEid structure, as specified in section 2.2.5.1.2.1.1.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] If the value of the FolderInThisStore field is 0x00, the contents of this field [FolderEID] can be any value that the client finds useful for locating the destination folder when the client processes a DAM that it receives from the server.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] The OP_MOVE ActionData structure MUST be in the following format for an extended rule. [StoreEIDSize, StoreEID, FolderEIDSize, and FolderEID].

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] The OP_COPY ActionData structure MUST be in the following format for an extended rule. [StoreEIDSize, StoreEID, FolderEIDSize, and FolderEID].
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] The destination folder for a Move action in an extended rule MUST be in the user's mailbox.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] The destination folder for a Copy action in an extended rule MUST be in the user's mailbox.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] StoreEIDSize (4 bytes): An integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the StoreEID field.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] StoreEID (variable): This field is not used and can be set to any non-null value by the client and server.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] StoreEID (variable): This field MUST be ignored when received by the client.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] StoreEID (variable): This field MUST be be ignored when received by the server.
[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] FolderEIDSize (4 bytes): An integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the FolderEID field.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] FolderEID (variable): A Folder EntryID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.4.1, [In OP_COPY action data] identifies the destination folder.

[In OP_MOVE and OP_COPY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] FolderEID (variable): A Folder EntryID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.4.1, [In OP_MOVE action data] identifies the destination folder.
[In ServerEid Structure] The ServerEid structure contains details about the destination folder.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R980, MS-OXORULE_R982, MS-OXORULE_R983.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In ServerEid Structure] Ours (1 byte): The value 0x01 indicates that the remaining bytes conform to this structure [ServerEid].
[In ServerEid Structure] Ours (1 byte): the value 0x00 indicates that the remaining bytes conform to a client-defined structure.
[In ServerEid Structure] Ours (1 byte): This field MUST be set to 0x01.
[In ServerEid Structure] FolderId (8 bytes): A Folder ID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1, identifies the destination folder.
[In ServerEid Structure] MessageId (8 bytes): This field is not used and MUST be set to all zeros.
[In ServerEid Structure] Instance (4 bytes): This field is not used and MUST be set to all zeros.

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] The ActionData structure used in an action (2) of type "OP_REPLY" or "OP_OOF_REPLY" is one of two formats, depending on whether the rule (2) is a standard rule or an extended rule.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R992, MS-OXORULE_R993, MS-OXORULE_R995, MS-OXORULE_R996.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] Prior to creating a rule (2) that has an action (2) of "OP_REPLY" or "OP_OOF_REPLY", the client is required to first create an FAI message to be used as the reply template.
[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] For details about creating a reply template, see section 3.1.4.2.5.

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The OP_REPLY ActionData structure MUST be in the following format for a standard rule. [ReplyTemplateFID, ReplyTemplateMID, ReplyTemplateGUID]

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData structure MUST be in the following format for a standard rule. [ReplyTemplateFID, ReplyTemplateMID, ReplyTemplateGUID]

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] ReplyTemplateFID (8 bytes): A Folder ID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1, that identifies the folder that contains the reply template.

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] ReplyTemplateMID (8 bytes): A Message ID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2, that identifies the FAI message being used as the reply template.
[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] ReplyTemplateGUID (16 bytes): A GUID that is generated by the client in the process of creating a reply template.

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The value of the ReplyTemplateGUID field in OP_REPLY action data is equal to the value of the PidTagReplyTemplateId property (section 2.2.9.2) that is set on the reply template.

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Standard Rules] The value of the ReplyTemplateGUID field in OP_OOF_REPLY action data is equal to the value of the PidTagReplyTemplateId property (section 2.2.9.2) that is set on the reply template.

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] The OP_REPLY ActionData structure MUST be in the following format for an extended rule. [MessageEIDSize, ReplyTemplateMessageEID, ReplyTemplateGUID]

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] The OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData structure MUST be in the following format for an extended rule. [MessageEIDSize, ReplyTemplateMessageEID, ReplyTemplateGUID]
[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] MessageEIDSize (4 bytes): An integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the ReplyTemplateMessageEID field.

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] ReplyTemplateMessageEID (70 bytes): A Message EntryID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.4.2, that contains the entry ID of the reply template.
[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] ReplyTemplateGUID (16 bytes): A GUID that is generated by the client in the process of creating a reply template.

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] The value of the ReplyTemplateGUID field in OP_REPLY action data is equal to the value of the PidTagReplyTemplateId property that is set on the reply template.

[OP_REPLY and OP_OOF_REPLY ActionData Structure] [Buffer Format for Extended Rules] The value of the ReplyTemplateGUID field in OP_OOF_REPLY action data is equal to the value of the PidTagReplyTemplateId property that is set on the reply template.

[In OP_DEFER_ACTION ActionData Structure] If one or more actions (2) for a specific rule (2) cannot be executed on the server, the rule (2) is required to be a client-side rule, with a value in the ActionType field of "OP_DEFER_ACTION".
[In OP_DEFER_ACTION ActionData Structure] Execution of the rule (2) is postponed until the client is available.
[In OP_DEFER_ACTION ActionData Structure] The client encodes the rule (2) information as a client-dependent data structure designating the action (2) to be performed.
[In OP_DEFER_ACTION ActionData Structure] The format is client-implementation-dependent and contains enough information to allow the client to perform the client-side operation when requested.

[In OP_DEFER_ACTION ActionData Structure] The size of the buffer is obtained by reading the value in the ActionLength field in the ActionBlock structure containing an OP_DEFER_ACTION in the ActionType field.
[In OP_DEFER_ACTION ActionData Structure] If the action (2) type is "OP_DEFER_ACTION", the ActionData structure is completely under the control of the client that created the rule (2).
[In OP_DEFER_ACTION ActionData Structure] This structure MUST be treated as an opaque BLOB by the server.

[In OP_DEFER_ACTION ActionData Structure] When a message that satisfies the rule (2) condition is received, the server creates a DAM and places the entire content of the ActionBlocks field of the RuleAction structure in the PidTagClientActions property (section 2.2.6.6) on the DAM as specified in sections 3.2.5.1.2, 2.2.6, and 2.2.6.6.

[In OP_FORWARD and OP_DELEGATE ActionData Structure] The ActionData structure that MUST be used with the "OP_FORWARD" and "OP_DELEGATE" action (2) types is formatted as follows: RecipientCount and RecipientBlocks.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R323, MS-OXORULE_R324, and other specific requirements in section 2.2.5.1.2.4.1.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_FORWARD and OP_DELEGATE ActionData Structure] RecipientCount (4 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of RecipientBlockData structures, as specified in section 2.2.5.1.2.4.1, contained in the RecipientBlocks field.
[In OP_FORWARD and OP_DELEGATE ActionData Structure] RecipientCount (4 bytes): This number MUST be greater than zero.
[In OP_FORWARD and OP_DELEGATE ActionData Structure] RecipientBlocks (variable): An array of RecipientBlockData structures, each of which specifies information about one recipient (2).
[In RecipientBlockData Structure] The RecipientBlockData structure contains properties that specify information about a recipient (2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R1003.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RecipientBlockData Structure] The client is required to, at a minimum, include the PidTagDisplayName ([MS-OXCFOLD] section 2.2.2.2.2.5), PidTagEmailAddress ([MS-OXOABK] section 2.2.3.14), and PidTagRecipientType ([MS-OXOMSG] section 2.2.3.1) properties.

[In RecipientBlockData Structure] Some rules (2) MAY<8> require more [specify values for more properties besides the PidTagDisplayName, PidTagEmailAddress, and PidTagRecipientType in the forward/delegate ActionData buffer].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXORULE_R895, MS-OXORULE_R636.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RecipientBlockData Structure] The RecipientBlockData structure has the following format: Reserved, NoOfProperties, and PropertyValues.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXORULE_R330, MS-OXORULE_R1006.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RecipientBlockData Structure] Reserved (1 byte): This value is implementation-specific and not required for interoperability.<9>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXORULE_R632, MS-OXORULE_R633.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RecipientBlockData Structure] NoOfProperties (4 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of structures present in the PropertyValues field.
[In RecipientBlockData Structure] NoOfProperties (4 bytes): This number MUST be greater than zero.
[In RecipientBlockData Structure] PropertyValues (variable): An array of TaggedPropertyValue structures, each of which contains a property that provides some information about the recipient (2).
[In RecipientBlockData Structure] The format of the TaggedPropertyValue structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.4.
[In OP_BOUNCE ActionData Structure] The OP_BOUNCE ActionData structure is specified as follows: BounceCode.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS_OXORULE_R340.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_BOUNCE ActionData Structure] BounceCode (4 bytes): An integer that specifies a bounce code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS_OXORULE_R340.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_BOUNCE ActionData Structure] The bounce code MUST be one of the following values. [0x0000000D, 0x0000001F, and 0x00000026].
[In OP_BOUNCE ActionData Structure] The meaning of the BounceCode value 0x0000000D: The message was rejected because it was too large.
[In OP_BOUNCE ActionData Structure] The meaning of the BounceCode value 0x0000001F: The message was rejected because it cannot be displayed to the user.
[In OP_BOUNCE ActionData Structure] The meaning of the BounceCode value 0x00000026: The message delivery was denied for other reasons.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_TAG ActionData Structure] An OP_TAG ActionData structure is a TaggedPropertyValue structure, packaged as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.4.
[In OP_DELETE or OP_MARK_AS_READ ActionData Structure] For the OP_DELETE action type, the incoming messages are deleted<10>.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R898.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In OP_DELETE or OP_MARK_AS_READ ActionData Structure] For the OP_MARK_AS_READ action type, the incoming messages are marked as read according to the ActionType itself.
[In OP_DELETE or OP_MARK_AS_READ ActionData Structure] These actions [OP_DELETE, OP_MARK_AS_READ] (3) have no ActionData structure.
[In DAM Syntax] A DAM has to be created by the server to indicate to the client that it needs to further process a client-side rule action (2).
[In DAM Syntax] This process [of creating a DAM] is specified in section 3.2.5.1.2.
[In DAM Syntax] Extended rules are not used in DAMs.

[In DAM Syntax] In addition to properties required on any message (as specified in [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.1), the following properties [PidTagMessageClass, PidTagDamBackPatched, PidTagDamOriginalEntryId, PidTagRuleProvider, PidTagRuleFolderEntryId, PidTagClientActions, PidTagRuleIds, PidTagDeferredActionMessageOriginalEntryId] are specific to a DAM.
[In PidTagMessageClass] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagMessageClass] The PidTagMessageClass property ([MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.1.3) MUST be set to "IPC.Microsoft Exchange 4.0.Deferred Action".
[In PidTagDamBackPatched property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagDamBackPatched property] The PidTagDamBackPatched property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.649) MUST be set to "FALSE" when the DAM is generated.

[In PidTagDamBackPatched property] It [The PidTagDamBackPatched property] MUST be set to "TRUE" if the DAM was updated by the server as a result of a RopUpdateDeferredActionMessages request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.3).
[In PidTagDamOriginalEntryId] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagDamOriginalEntryId Property] This PidTagDamOriginalEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.650) MUST be set to the EntryID of the delivered (target) message that the client has to process.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRuleProvider] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRuleProvider] The PidTagRuleProvider property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.951) MUST be set to the same value as the PidTagRuleProvider property on the rule or rules that have generated the DAM.
[In PidTagRuleFolderEntryId] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagRuleFolderEntryId Property] The PidTagRuleFolderEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.939) MUST be set to the EntryID of the folder where the rule (2) that triggered the generation of this DAM is stored.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagClientActions] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagClientActions] The PidTagClientActions property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.625) is a binary buffer specifying the actions (2) the client is required to take on the message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXORULE_R362.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagClientActions] The buffer MUST be packed according to the RuleAction structure specified in section 2.2.5.

[In PidTagClientActions] The server is required to set values in this property according to the relevant actions (2) as they were set by the client when the rule (2) was created by using the RopModifyRules ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.1).

[In PidTagClientActions Property] The server is required to set values in this property according to the relevant actions (2) as they were set by the client when the rule (2) was changed by using the RopModifyRules ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.11.1).

[In PidTagClientActions] Note that the server can combine actions (2) from different rules (2) into one DAM, in which case the RuleAction structures will be concatenated in the DAM's PidTagClientActions property by using the proper action (2) syntax specified in section 2.2.5.
[In PidTagRuleIds] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagRuleIds] The PidTagRuleIds property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.941) is a buffer contains the PidTagRuleId (section 2.2.1.3.1.1) value (8 bytes) from the first rules (2) that contributed actions (2) in the PidTagClientActions property (section 2.2.6.6), and repeats that value once for each rule (2) that contributed actions (2).
[In PidTagRuleIds] The length of this binary property [PidTagRuleIds] MUST be a multiple of 8 bytes.
[In PidTagDeferredActionMessageOriginalEntryId Property] Type: PtypServerId ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagDeferredActionMessageOriginalEntryId Property] The PidTagDeferredActionMessageOriginalEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.652) contains the server EntryID for the DAM message on the server.
[In PidTagDeferredActionMessageOriginalEntryId Property] This property is set by the server when the DAM is created.
[In DEM Syntax] A DEM SHOULD be created by the server when an error is encountered while executing a rule (2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXORULE_R896.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In DEM Syntax] This process [creating a DEM] is specified in section 3.2.5.1.3.
[In DEM Syntax] Extended rules (2) are not used in DEMs.

[In DEM Syntax] In addition to properties required on any message, as specified in [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.1, the following properties[PidTagMessageClass, PidTagRuleError, PidTagRuleActionType, PidTagRuleActionNumber, PidTagRuleProvider, PidTagDamOriginalEntryId, PidTagRuleFolderEntryId, PidTagRuleId] are specific to a DEM.
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] The PidTagMessageClass property ([MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.1.3) MUST be set to "IPC.Microsoft Exchange 4.0.Deferred Error".
[In PidTagRuleError Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagRuleError Property] The PidTagRuleError property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.938) MUST be set to one of the following values [0x00000001, 0x00000002, 0x00000003, 0x00000004, 0x00000005, 0x00000006, 0x00000007, 0x00000008, 0x00000009, 0x0000000a, 0x0000000b, 0x0000000c, 0x0000000d, and 0x0000000e], indicating the cause of the error encountered during the execution of the rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleError] The meaning of the value 0x00000001: Generic error that doesn't fall into any of the other categories.
[In PidTagRuleError] The meaning of the value 0x00000002: Error opening the rules folder.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x00000003: Error delivering the message.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x00000004: Error while parsing the rule format.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x00000005: Error processing the rule (2).
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x00000006: Error moving or copying the message to the destination folder.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x00000007: Permission error moving or copying the message to the destination folder.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x00000008: Error creating the DAM.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x00000009: Error sending as another user.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x0000000A: Error retrieving the reply template.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x0000000B: Generic error while executing the rule (2) on the server.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x0000000C: Error processing rule (2) due to mailbox quotas.
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x0000000D: Error processing the message due to the large number of recipients (2).
[In PidTagRuleError Property] The meaning of the value 0x0000000E: Error copying or moving a message due to folder quotas.
[In PidTagRuleActionType Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
